channel.title: Posts on Society for Open Software
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Society for Open Software

item.title: Cruxipher
item.description: For ATMOS 2022, we worked with Crux on Cruxipher - a CTF event that tested software development, cryptography and UNIX skills.

item.title: Shell Basics
item.description: The Shell Basics workshop was conducted on the first of October. The workshop covered the basics of using shell interfaces such as bash and zsh. Poster for the workshop: (Made in GIMP, as usual)

item.title: Cepheus CTF 23 Writeup
item.description: Cepheus CTF 23 Writeup Cepheus CTF was one of the first Capture the Flag (CTF) tournaments we took part in. This competition was hosted by IIT Goa and saw more than 20 teams compete to score the most points before the timer ran out. Despite the fierce competition, we managed to bag first place. This post contains some of the more interesting questions we solved for this CTF. These were some of the interesting questions : Phonic anomaly: (50) Your team has received an email containing an audio file.

item.title: Dualbooting Workshop
item.description: Our very first event as a society was a workshop on dualbooting Linux with Windows. It took place on 19th June, 2022 at F204 in the OAB. Here is a clip from the event: This was the poster for the event: (Made in GIMP, of course)
